intro: Hadrolaelia dayana, commonly known as the Dragon's Blood Orchid, is a rare and striking orchid native to the high-altitude regions of southern China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red petals and a distinctive, elongated lip. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats, thriving in cool, humid environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators with their intense coloration and unique shape. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
